author: Special Correspondent
text:
Candidates contesting the Assembly election can incur a maximum expenditure of Rs. 28 lakh each.

Disclosing this at a meeting with all-party representatives which discussed the schedule of rates for various activities of election campaign here on Friday, Collector K.S. Palanisamy said the expenditure of the candidates would be calculated based on the rates fixed in the list. The rates for erecting pandals, dais, sound and light equipment, vehicles and food rates have been listed in the schedule.

Mr. Palanisamy disclosed that permission for vehicles, public meetings, and rallies should be obtained at least 48 hours prior to the events. Permission should be obtained for the venue and the time of meetings. Permission should be obtained from the police for use of loud speakers under the single window system.

All election-related advertisements in television and local channels should be certified by the committee headed by district collector.
title: Collector holds meeting with political parties
